questionTask.text: What are some of the dishes mentioned in the text?
What is the origin of Leek and Potato soup?
What is the process for making mashed potatoes in the text?

statementsTask.text:
The sources mention several dishes, including a dish served before or between two principal courses of a meal, an Indian dish consisting of spices, rice, and meat or vegetables, a stew, and a chicken dish with thyme, white wine, and stock. Additionally, there is a suggestion to serve one of the dishes with cheese and onion bread. Some people also brought main course and dessert recipes. The sources also emphasize the importance of food as a center of community and a place for people to come together and enjoy everyday life.

Sources:

[1] a dish served before the main course, or between two principal courses of a meal
[2] Serve with cheese and onion bread for a warming supper or lunch.
[3] indian dish consists of spices, rice and meat or vegetables
[4] indian dish consists of spices, rice and meat or vegetables
[5] Some brought main course recipe, and some brought dessert recipe.
[6] Food as the centre of a community, food as the focus of a place where everybody comes together to share, learn and enjoy everyday life.
[7] Return the chicken pieces to the dish along with the thyme, white wine and stock.
[8] Put the chopped tomatoes, chicken and salt, garam masala, green chilli, corri-ander.

[21] Leek and Potato soup
[22] Leek and potato soup is a classic British recipe
[23] Leek and potato soup is a classic British recipe
[24] It is also known as Vichyssoise, and is believed to have originated in France
[25] 2 tbsp tomato puree
[26] 1.2l hot vegetable stock
[27] (made with boiling water and 4
[28] rounded tsp bouillon powder
[29] or 2 stock cubes)
[30] Firstly, prepare your vegetables.
[31] You need 1-1.25kg ripe tomatoes.
[32] If the tomatoes are on their vines, pull them off.
[33] The green stalky bits should come off at the same time, but if they don’t, just pull or twist them off afterwards.
[34] Throw the vines and green bits away and wash the tomatoes.
[35] Now cut each tomato into quarters and slice off any hard cores (they don’t soften during cooking and you’d get hard bits in the soup at the end).
[36] Peel 1 medium onion and 1 small carrot and chop them into small pieces.
[37] Chop 1 celery stick roughly the same size.
[38] Spoon 2 tbsp olive oil into a large heavy based pan and heat it over a low heat.
[39] Hold your hand over the pan until you can feel the heat rising from the oil, then tip in the onion, carrot and celery and mix them together with a wooden spoon.
[40] Still with the heat low, cook the vegetables until they’re soft and faintly coloured.
[41] This should take about 10 mins and you should stir them two or three times so they cook evenly and don’t stick to the bottom of the pan.
[42] Holding the tube over the pan, squirt in about 2 tbsp of tomato puree, then stir it around so it turns the vegetables red.
[43] Shoot the tomatoes in off the chopping board, sprinkle in a good pinch of sugar and grind in a little black pepper.
[44] Tear 2 bay leaves into a few pieces and throw them into the pan.
[45] Stir to mix everything together, put the lid on the pan and let the tomatoes stew over a low heat for 10 mins until they shrink down in the pan and their juices flow nicely.
[46] From time to time, give the pan a good shake – this will keep everything well mixed.
[47] Slowly pour in the hot stock, stirring at the same time to mix it with the vegetables.
[48] Turn up the heat as high as it will go and wait until everything is bubbling, then turn the heat down to low again and put the lid back on the pan.
[49] Cook gently for 25 mins, stirring a couple of times.
[50] At the end of cooking the tomatoes will have broken down and be very slushy looking.
[51] Remove the pan from the heat, take the lid off and stand back for a few seconds or so while the steam escapes, then fish out the pieces of bay leaf and throw them away.
[52] It is also known as Vichyssoise, and is believed to have originated in France

The origin of Leek and Potato soup is uncertain, but one theory suggests that it may have originated from the Persian word for rice, "birinj". However, it is known that Leek and Potato soup is a classic British recipe. The soup is made by boiling chopped potatoes and sliced leeks, and it can be mashed to create a dish. Some variations of the soup include fresh and ground coriander, which adds flavor and health benefits. The soup can also be frozen for up to three months.

To make mashed potatoes, first, place the peeled and cut potatoes into a medium saucepan and boil them until they are done. Then, drain the water and place the steaming hot potatoes into a large bowl. Add milk and beat until the mashed potatoes are smooth, but be careful not to overbeat them or they will end up gluey. Finally, pour the heated cream and melted butter over the potatoes.

Sources:
[0] A dish prepared by mashing boiled potatoes
[1] Add milk and beat until the mashed potatoes are smooth.
[2] Don’t over beat the potatoes or the mashed potatoes will end up gluey.
[3] When the potatoes are done, drain the water and place the steaming hot potatoes into a large bowl.
[4] Pour the heated cream and melted butter over the potatoes.

To make mashed potatoes, first peel and cut 680G Yukon Gold potatoes lengthwise into quarters [1]. Add cold water to the pan until the potatoes are covered by at least an inch and cook them [2]. While the potatoes are cooking, melt the butter and warm the cream [3]. Once the potatoes are cooked, mash them with a potato masher [4].

Sources:
[1] 680G Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and cut lengthwise into quarters
[2] Add cold water to the pan until the potatoes are covered by at least an inch.
[3] While the potatoes are cooking, melt the butter and warm the cream.
[4] Mash the potatoes with a potato masher.

qaTask.question: What is the origin of Leek and Potato soup?
qaTask.answer:
The origin of Leek and Potato soup is uncertain, but one theory suggests that it may have originated from the Persian word for rice, "birinj". However, it is known that Leek and Potato soup is a classic British recipe. The soup is made by boiling chopped potatoes and sliced leeks, and it can be mashed to create a dish. Some variations of the soup include fresh and ground coriander, which adds flavor and health benefits. The soup can also be frozen for up to three months.

qaTask.question: What is the process for making mashed potatoes in the text?
qaTask.answer:
To make mashed potatoes, first, place the peeled and cut potatoes into a medium saucepan and boil them until they are done. Then, drain the water and place the steaming hot potatoes into a large bowl. Add milk and beat until the mashed potatoes are smooth, but be careful not to overbeat them or they will end up gluey. Finally, pour the heated cream and melted butter over the potatoes.

[3] When the potatoes are done, drain the water and place the steaming hot potatoes into a large bowl.
[4] Pour the heated cream and melted butter over the potatoes.

qaTask.question: Describe the ingredients and cooking steps for Root Vegetable Biryani.
qaTask.answer:
Root Vegetable Biryani is a dish that has its roots in Persian cuisine. The name "biryani" is derived from the Persian language. One theory suggests that it comes from the word "biryan" or "beriyan," which means to fry or roast. The dish is made with a variety of vegetables, including potatoes, onions, and carrots. To prepare the dish, the vegetables are first cooked until they are soft and faintly colored. Then, ground coriander and potatoes are stirred in and cooked for one minute. Chopped tomatoes, chicken, salt, garam masala, green chili, and coriander are added to the mixture. The dish is then cooked on low heat until the vegetables are fully cooked. Finally, semolina and khoya are mixed together to make dough, which is then added to the dish. The dish is then cooked until the dough is fully cooked. 

INGREDIENTS: potatoes, onions, carrots, ground coriander, chopped tomatoes, chicken, salt, garam masala, green chili, coriander, semolina, khoya.

Sources:
[0] Root Vegetable Biryani
[1] The word “biryani” is derived from Persian language.
[2] Another theory is that it derives from “biryan” or “beriyan” (to fry or roast)
[3] Stir in the ground coriander and potato, then cook for 1 min.
[4] Put the chopped tomatoes, chicken and salt, garam masala, green chilli, corri-ander.
[5] Still with the heat low, cook the vegetables until they’re soft and faintly coloured.

qaTask.question: Describe the ingredients and cooking steps for Root Vegetable Biryani.
qaTask.answer:
To make Root Vegetable Biryani, you will need medium potatoes, sweet potatoes, swede, garlic cloves, carrots, parsnips, medium curry powder, chat masala, dried rice, and chopped coriander [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] [6] [7] [8]. First, place the onion, potatoes, swede, garlic, carrots, and parsnips in a large pan [9]. Cover with 900ml of boiling water, bring to boil, reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes [10]. Then, add the curry powder and chat masala, stir and cook for a further 2 minutes [11]. Finally, add the rice and stirring often, cook for 20 minutes until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed [12]. Serve sprinkled with chopped coriander [13].

Sources:
[1]  medium potatos, peeled and chopped
[2]  medium sweet potatos peeled and chopped
[3]  swede, peeled and chopped
[4]  garlic doves, peeled and crushed
[5]  carrots, peeled and sliced 4 medium parsnips, peeled and sliced
[6]  carrots, peeled and sliced 4 medium parsnips, peeled and sliced
[7]  tbsp medium curry powder 1tbsp chat masala 350g died rice chopped coriander to serve
[8]  tbsp medium curry powder 1tbsp chat masala 350g died rice chopped coriander to serve
[9] Place the onion, potatos, swede, garlic, carrots and parsnips in a large pan
[10] Cover with 900ml of boiling water, bring to boil, reduce the heat and simmer for 15 min
[11] Add the curry powder and chat masa-la, stir and cook for further 2 minutes
[12] Add the rice and stiring often, cook for 20 min until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed
[13] Serve sprinkled with chopped coriander

qaTask.question: How to make Mango Sorbet?
qaTask.answer:
To make Mango Sorbet, place the mango flesh, sweetener, and yogurt in a food processor and blend until smooth. Serve garnished with fresh mango slices.

Sources:
[0]  Place the mango flesh in a food processor with the sweetener and yogurt.

qaTask.question: How to make Mango Sorbet?
qaTask.answer:
To make Mango Sorbet, you will need 305g fresh mango, peeled and stoned, plus slices to garnish [1]. Place the mango flesh in a food processor with the sweetener and yogurt [2]. Freeze the mixture for 2-3 hours or until the sides and the base of the sorbet have started to set but the center is still liquid [3]. Finally, transfer the sorbet to the fridge for 10-15 minutes before scooping into bowls [4].

Sources:
[1] 305g fresh mango, peeled and stoned, plus slices to garnish
[2]  Place the mango flesh in a food processor with the sweetener and yogurt.
[3] Freeze for 2 -3 hours or until the sides and the base of the  sorbet have started to set but center is still liquid
[4] Transfer the sorbet to fridge for 10 – 15 mintures before scooping into bowls
